column1: CVE-2018-1000030 python2.7 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.4- MEDIUM "Python 2.7.14 is vulnerable to a Heap-Buffer-Overflow as well as a Heap-Use-After-Free. column3: but Thread1 is already writing to the buffer without knowing how much to write. So when a large amount of data is being processed
column4: it is very easy to cause memory corruption using a Heap-Buffer-Overflow. As for the Use-After-Free
column5: Thread3->Malloc->Thread1->Free's->Thread2-Re-uses-Free'd Memory. The PSRT has stated that this is not a security vulnerability due to the fact that the attacker must be able to run code
column7: such as function as a service
column8: this vulnerability can potentially be used by an attacker to violate a trust boundary
column9: as such the DWF feels this issue deserves a CVE."
